verses.text: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

similars.text: Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)

verses.text: The same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.

similars.text: Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

similars.text: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.

similars.text: For he that speaketh in an unknown tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man understandeth him; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.
He that is of God heareth God's words: ye therefore hear them not, because ye are not of God.
For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.

And wo be unto him that will not hearken unto the words of Jesus, and also to them whom he hath chosen and sent among them; for whoso receiveth not the words of Jesus and the words of those whom he hath sent receiveth not him; and therefore he will not receive them at the last day;
And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.
And it shall be given unto you, power over that spirit; and you shall proclaim against that spirit with a loud voice that it is not of God--
To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
But since ye say, The burden of the Lord; therefore thus saith the Lord; Because ye say this word, The burden of the Lord, and I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of the Lord;
Wherefore I give you to understand, that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calleth Jesus accursed: and that no man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the Holy Ghost.
And the Spirit shall be given unto you by the prayer of faith; and if ye receive not the Spirit ye shall not teach.
And whoso receiveth not by the Spirit, cannot be benefited. Therefore it is not needful that it should be translated. Amen.

verses.text: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.

similars.text: They are they into whose hands the Father has given all things--
Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;
For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.
They are they into whose hands the Father has given all things--

verses.text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.

similars.text: He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.
That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.
He that believeth on the Son of God hath the witness in himself: he that believeth not God hath made him a liar; because he believeth not the record that God gave of his Son.
And it shall come to pass that whosoever shall believe on the Son of God, the same shall have everlasting life.
He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.

The soul that sinneth, it shall die. The son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, neither shall the father bear the iniquity of the son: the righteousness of the righteous shall be upon him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon him.
And it shall come to pass that whosoever shall believe on the Son of God, the same shall have everlasting life.
He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.
That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.
He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.
For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
